message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.SI

This paper deals with machine learning algorithms and fairness, which are topics that are commonly studied in the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses auditing and mitigating bias in classification models, which falls under the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society). The paper also touches upon issues related to discrimination, which is a topic studied in the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The use of machine learning algorithms to make consequential decisions is also a topic studied in the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper proposes a methodology for achieving fairness while preserving good predictive performance, which is a topic studied in the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
